sentence.text: She consoled herself with the thought that Pet would have been dead before it happened .
She climbed wearily out of bed , consoling herself that her physical injuries , at least , were healing fast .
She consoled herself with the fact that her daughter understood .
She wished she had worn her new suit , but she consoled herself that at the moment he did n't care what she looked like .
But I can console myself that at least I had fun .
` I consoled myself that the quality of friendships was more important than the quantity . "
You can console yourself with the thought that you did your best .
It consoled him to know you were going to settle down and have children .
They stood wordless , like friends consoling the bereaved .
“ Mama , let me go and talk to her , console her … ”
` But if you were Penelope Huntley you might not have been consoled by the thought that your children would inherit after Miss Morgan 's death . "
The counsellor was consoled by Elizabeth Lavenza , who sat next to him .
Each of these enforced recruits was consoled with a bounty of £1 , a similar amount being paid ‘ to the constable or other officer ’ who had rounded him up .
I consoled myself by drinking a lot of warm red Martini .
STAFF at Pakistan Airlines wept as they consoled victims ' relatives .
